duties_responsibilities.duty: Plan and present lesson plans, create assessments, and ensure the needs of all students in the classroom are being met.
Oversee education and training of students with physical, emotional, mental, and learning disabilities.
Collaborate with school support staff and parents to help students develop and socialize.
Utilize the parallel teaching model as the main model for teaching and learning.
Assess students’ skills and learning requirements and design annual Individualized Educational Plans (I.E.P’s) for students.
Provide research-based specialized instruction to address the instructional goals and objectives contained within each student’s IEP.
Monitor students’ behavioral patterns and arrange appropriate interventions if needed.
Attend and prepare special education evaluation and reevaluation meetings.
Support new initiatives, including the use of blended learning and project-based learning.
Supervise the health, safety, and welfare of students at all times.
Utilize all avenues to incorporate past lessons, the performance standards, and staff development sessions to design and deliver outstanding lessons.
Organize classroom, including materials and visual aids in an educationally appropriate way.
Record each student’s progress through both monitoring forms and marking books.
Prepare progress reports, report cards, and arrange and conduct Parent-Teacher Conferences.
Interact with students in a firm, positive, and constructive way.
Recognize and encourage positive behavior.
Perform additional duties as assigned.
Support positive connections among students and the larger community.
Establish and maintain student control and discipline in the classroom.
Collaborate and consult with educational professionals and community service providers regarding the needs of students.
Provide consultation to classroom teachers regarding classroom adaptations, instructional modifications, and other similar instructional interventions.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree required; Master’s Degree preferred. Active New York State Special Education Teaching Certification required.
